definitions.text:
1. In Jewish antiquity, offering which had life; animal offered to God; opposition to the mincha, which was offering without life.It is gift, corban by whatsoever thou mightest be profited by me; that is, I have devoted that to God which you of me, and it is no longer mine to give.
2. An alms-basket; vessel to receive gifts of charity; gift; alms; treasury of the church, where offerings are deposited.
3. Among Mohammedans, ceremony performed the foot of mount Arrarat Arabia, near Mecca. It consists killing the number of sheep, and distributing them among the poor.
